page.title: 04CLIFTON HILL SPORTS CENTRE
page.content: Clifton Hill is one of Exeter's new main features. It cost about Â£700000 and took 1 year to build. Its grey corrugated building with red portholes hopes to attract up to 70000 people a year. Its facilities include a sports hall, two squash courts, a fitness room, a table tennis room and a bar. There are 5 full time staff including the manager, 3 supervisors and a receptionist. There are also numerous part time staff and cleaners. It is run by the Exeter City Council Leisure Services. It is not profit making. The centre caters for all ages. It holds sessions for disabled people. It is open from 9am to 11pm. Membership costs Â£5.25 per adult or Â£7.85 per family.
